result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie Lynn Berka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 120 DAYS TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING: 
*   Court ordered the Defendant to pay the Mandatory DNA fee out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due on or before 12-27-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Court ordered that the Defendant to follow all the conditions previously ordered on 03-11-2016 on the Sentencing.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Benedict Center

Letter from DOC requesting amended judgment of conviction.
NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF, SIGNED 3/11/2016

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Defendant sentence withheld. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve days 30 days condition time
          in the House of Correction IMPOSED AND STAYED
          to be used at the agent's discretion.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No new law violation that arises to Probable Cause.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by March 13, 2017 
          or a civil judgement be entered.
     *   DNA sample to be taken after today's proceedings and 
          surcharge to be paid. 
     *   Restitution is set at $0.00.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed.
Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders previously issued and stayed warrant canceled.

Justice Point Program Violation Report, missed office appointment and drug test, dated March 4, 2016; received and filed. Court reviewed report and takes no action at this time.

Attorney Reyna Morales appears in court on behalf of Francisco Araiza.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.

Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 31.  Calendar call scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Justice Point Program violation report: Missed Office Contact; received and filed. Court reviewed violation and takes no action at this time.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Paul J. Manley in court. Kelly Oneill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for sentencing hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes her plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Katie Lynn Berka in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/2/15 @ 1:30pm
